positive.review:
Out of all of the idle games I've played so far this one is my favourite. I have over 1000 hours and the statistics page says I'm still in the early game. The developer has a lot of passion for this game and has put in a lot of mechanics in over the years and more are being added and fleshed out.
Some examples: Clones, pets, training, monster slaying, monuments, divinity generator, your planet, adventure clone, might, challenges, etc.

Strong recommend if you like this genre of incremental semi-idles. I love the dopamine drip of the constant progress regardless of what else is going on in my life and the occasional problem solving to figure out an at least mostly optimal way to sequence my challenges and complete them well. I essentially beat the available content 3 years ago and then restarted a year ago and I'm having a blast going back through the game because the dev has added SOOOO much in the meantime and continues to add stuff regularly.

I have about 480 hrs into this game on the mobile app. I've been playing off and on for years and am still a noob. I'm at about 5% completed. This game is time consuming but that's why I play. The game is consistently receiving new updates. I've never played a mobile text based game as long as this one. 10 out of 10 here
Deep game although not as much idle play as you might expect from the name.  You will often need to actively play to manage different systems.

A deep Idle game that starts off fairly simple and then proceeds to pile more and more mechanics onto you, that all somehow fit together and make sense. Currently i am about 1 year or so in and i feel i have still more to do, more pets to progress, achievements to complete etc. 

So if you want an idle game with varied mechanics, different features and a very long progression arc this might be what you are looking for.

It's a fun game to just let open in the background.
Tip: DO the challenges, and buy the perk that let pets gain more then one level per clone.
It may not be the best out there, but certainly good enough to invest a [i]few[/i] hours in..

good game but its a massive timesink, been playing for like a year and a half (started on my phone and put it on here) and have like 460 days offline and 1 day and 12 hours online and im far from being anywhere halfway through, probably could only be 100% by a fuckin vampire because of how much time it would take
Such grind, but its ok!
Never ending content
best idle game around.
It's ok
Yes.
yuiyiyiyui
a+

1. this game eats up a lot of time
2. i got like 79 hours already, and im still not even past the super early stage
3. the clothes and decorations for your god are nice tho
4. id say check guides, or just ask in the discord, people there are friendly and actually give tips
5. benefits of this game? honestly none, its just something to play when youre bored, or to farm achievements, or flex a steam profile with like 10k+ hours
i run it on a thinkpad x220, arch linux, plugged in no battery, with a cooling pad just in case. it only uses around 5-6w, cause i usually have another game running too. without that, maybe 3-4w. i just leave it running day and night, then check progress when i wake up
6. rebirth as much as you can, every 1 or 2 days feels fine
This is no short game but ive been playing it for like 15 years now and it still is being actively updated and improved. But be warned i is a major time sink at first

As idle games go, this is easily the least exploitative one I've played (and I've played many). I've never once felt like progress was gatekept behind a paywall, nor do its systems require a deceptive amount of active-play. It's content-rich, a lot of stuff to do and it scratches that spreadsheet simulator feeling. If you don't like idle games this probably won't do it for you (and you're better off not falling into the addiction) but if you're looking for a new one, here's a good one.

Look up a guide or you will actively gimp yourself into reaching areas you 100% should not be at and are actually a hindrance toward real effective progress which will cause you to hit hard walls that are impossible to get past, oh also go play and beat all of cooking idle before even starting this

one of the pets take a minimum of 700+ hours to unlock once you start the quest for it

This is the BEST idle game EVER!! The sheer amount of content and depth it has is mind blowing. You would need to play this for at least a year or 2 to finally go past the early game. Best part is that the dev is very active and there are always new things to look forwards to.
Good simple classic idler that is fully accessible free to play with regular content updates

Out of all of the idle games I've played so far this one is my favourite. I have over 1000 hours and the statistics page says I'm still in the early game. The developer has a lot of passion for this game and has put in a lot of mechanics in over the years and more are being added and fleshed out.
Some examples: Clones, pets, training, monster slaying, monuments, divinity generator, your planet, adventure clone, might, challenges, etc.

Strong recommend if you like this genre of incremental semi-idles. I love the dopamine drip of the constant progress regardless of what else is going on in my life and the occasional problem solving to figure out an at least mostly optimal way to sequence my challenges and complete them well. I essentially beat the available content 3 years ago and then restarted a year ago and I'm having a blast going back through the game because the dev has added SOOOO much in the meantime and continues to add stuff regularly.

I have about 480 hrs into this game on the mobile app. I've been playing off and on for years and am still a noob. I'm at about 5% completed. This game is time consuming but that's why I play. The game is consistently receiving new updates. I've never played a mobile text based game as long as this one. 10 out of 10 here
Deep game although not as much idle play as you might expect from the name.  You will often need to actively play to manage different systems.

A deep Idle game that starts off fairly simple and then proceeds to pile more and more mechanics onto you, that all somehow fit together and make sense. Currently i am about 1 year or so in and i feel i have still more to do, more pets to progress, achievements to complete etc. 

So if you want an idle game with varied mechanics, different features and a very long progression arc this might be what you are looking for.

It's a fun game to just let open in the background.
Tip: DO the challenges, and buy the perk that let pets gain more then one level per clone.
Honestly it starts off slow but everything gives you a boost that you can feel, i wont say it speeds up but so far so good.

Recommended only for grindy lover
Took like 1 hr to beat first boss and you can see how grindy it could be
Spent most of the time on dressing avatar and playing mini game tho. the card one is fun

Probably a strong contender for the best idling game. Nothing but an absolute joy to figure out how to do something else, and how it keeps the game mechanically interesting as it applies to overall growth.

Игра 'Idling to Rule the Gods' – это увлекательный, хоть и очень нишевый, представитель жанра idle-игр. Сначала может показаться сложной из-за обилия механик и элементов, но после непродолжительного обучения становится довольно затягивающей. Суть геймплея заключается в управлении божествами, которые генерируют различные ресурсы для усиления себя и создания новых богов. Процесс идет в фоновом режиме, позволяя игроку заниматься другими делами, периодически возвращаясь для оптимизации и улучшений.

Игра предлагает огромное количество контента: разные виды ресурсов, престижи, перерождения, миры и божественные создания. Все это позволяет долгое время находить новые пути для оптимизации и увеличения мощности. Визуально игра проста, но функциональна. Интерфейс информативен, хоть и может показаться немного перегруженным.

Главный минус – это необходимость в активном участии на начальных этапах. Без понимания ключевых механик прогресс будет медленным. Тем не менее, если вы любите idle-игры и готовы потратить время на изучение, 'Idling to Rule the Gods' может стать приятным развлечением на долгое время. Она предлагает бесконечную кривую роста и постоянное чувство прогресса, что делает ее одной из лучших в своем жанре.
It may not be the best out there, but certainly good enough to invest a [i]few[/i] hours in..

Surprisingly engaging incremental game! It offers a satisfying sense of progression with a good balance between active play and hands-off idling. There's a lot of content and things to unlock, keeping you hooked for a long time. Definitely worth a try if you enjoy the genre.
Buen juego, todavía me queda aprender mejor como funciona, pero por ahora bien.

good game but its a massive timesink, been playing for like a year and a half (started on my phone and put it on here) and have like 460 days offline and 1 day and 12 hours online and im far from being anywhere halfway through, probably could only be 100% by a fuckin vampire because of how much time it would take
the most accurate paranoid schizophrenia simulator on the free market
Unlike other incrementals, this one engages your brain
Such grind, but its ok!
Never ending content
best idle game around.
Fun fun.
Funfun
number go up me like
It's ok
Yes.
yuiyiyiyui
a+

Some examples: Clones, pets, training, monster slaying, monuments, divinity generator, your planet, adventure clone, might, challenges, etc.

Strong recommend if you like this genre of incremental semi-idles. I love the dopamine drip of the constant progress regardless of what else is going on in my life and the occasional problem solving to figure out an at least mostly optimal way to sequence my challenges and complete them well. I essentially beat the available content 3 years ago and then restarted a year ago and I'm having a blast going back through the game because the dev has added SOOOO much in the meantime and continues to add stuff regularly.

I have about 480 hrs into this game on the mobile app. I've been playing off and on for years and am still a noob. I'm at about 5% completed. This game is time consuming but that's why I play. The game is consistently receiving new updates. I've never played a mobile text based game as long as this one. 10 out of 10 here

A deep Idle game that starts off fairly simple and then proceeds to pile more and more mechanics onto you, that all somehow fit together and make sense. Currently i am about 1 year or so in and i feel i have still more to do, more pets to progress, achievements to complete etc. 

So if you want an idle game with varied mechanics, different features and a very long progression arc this might be what you are looking for.

negative.review: It take YEARS to get to mid/late game, im not joking YEARS, look at my play time, im only at early midgame. This game is hostile to new players and does not respect your time
It take YEARS to get to mid/late game, im not joking YEARS, look at my play time, im only at early midgame. This game is hostile to new players and does not respect your time

Dev seems to think political assassinations are funny. Played this game as a background time waster for quite some time but this is the last straw.

There's been recurring issues with half baked mechanics(pets for instance - the village concept was introduced and continues to sit half-finished), constant power creep, adventure mode severely lacking in QoL and frequent save-breaking updates. I've lost count of how many times the dev has posted not to update due to the new changes breaking saves. This was one of the first idle games out on steam but it's gotten bloated and tired. Given how easy it is to find idle games these days there's much better and far more creative choices on the market.

Menus are terrible, UI is bland, and the art is all over the place. Art is possibly stolen because there is no consistency. The micro transactions are so overpriced, I’m led to believe this game might be a scheme for money laundering.
It take YEARS to get to mid/late game, im not joking YEARS, look at my play time, im only at early midgame. This game is hostile to new players and does not respect your time

It take YEARS to get to mid/late game, im not joking YEARS, look at my play time, im only at early midgame. This game is hostile to new players and does not respect your time

Dev seems to think political assassinations are funny. Played this game as a background time waster for quite some time but this is the last straw.

There's been recurring issues with half baked mechanics(pets for instance - the village concept was introduced and continues to sit half-finished), constant power creep, adventure mode severely lacking in QoL and frequent save-breaking updates. I've lost count of how many times the dev has posted not to update due to the new changes breaking saves. This was one of the first idle games out on steam but it's gotten bloated and tired. Given how easy it is to find idle games these days there's much better and far more creative choices on the market.
